Description: Our hours of operation are every second Tuesday of the month from 12 Noon 200 PM
Summary: Customer wants to know the hours of operation.
Comments: 092024 0438c8249284fe40dc890161d65a68f6d3Good afternoon Thank you for reaching out We will not be hosting another training session but there are tools available to assist you You can find a guide in PDF format called under the Partner Resource Tab on PartnerLink This document provides instructions on how to update your hours of operation Once you are logged into PartnerLink click on your agency name to access your Account Overview Under Additional Information you will find a button labeled Click on it to view the hours currently listed for your agency If the hours are correct click to confirm If the hours are not correct please make the necessary changes by clicking aedita submit them and once approved by your Regional Coordinator the updated hours will be officially updated Screenshots have been included to provide visual guidance If you still need assistance please attend one of our online Office Hours every Wednesday from 10am10am Thank you CiArra
input_text: Agency Administration -> Partner Trainings | Customer wants to know the hours of operation.

Description: Hi Partner Support We were told that cases of fresh vegetables would be available some time ago They are never available when were placing our orders So does that mean they are really never going to be available anymore for small sites with no dock availabilty We have not been able to pick up fresh vegetables since Covid began and inhouse shopping was discontinued Your positive response would be appreciated MaryAnn Tolbert
Summary: Customer is inquiring about the availability of fresh vegetables and expresses frustration with the lack of availability.
Comments: 012025 0814Good afternoon Thank you for reaching out to Customer Relations I appreciate your inquiry We offer a variety of fruits and vegetables on our menu throughout the week but the selection can vary depending on seasonal availability During the winter months for example we typically have fewer options compared to the summer when a wider variety of produce is available In recent weeks the fruits and vegetables available have primarily included potatoes apples and carrots Due to producelimitations placed on agencies our Food Resources Team is working to bring in more produce items in case lot instead of large bins and full pallets but this remains an ongoing challenge Currently all produce items must be ordered through PartnerLink as there are no plans to reopen the agency mart for direct pickups I have two suggestions to enhance your experience in this situation First you can place orders up to 10 days in advance of your scheduled pickup and delivery date I recommend placing your order as soon as the calendar opens and frequently checking PartnerLink for available produce You can edit and add to your order until it locks for fulfillment which is three business days prior to the shipment date This flexibility allows you to include any additional items you may find during that 10day window Another option is to explore our TEFAP program a governmentsubsidized initiative through which participating partners can access additional items to supplement their regular orders Please note that this program has specific requirements and is managed by the TEFAP team For more information you can reach out to Zaynab the DC TEFAP coordinator Thank you Best regards
input_text: Orders - Pre delivery -> Produce Request | Customer is inquiring about the availability of fresh vegetables and expresses frustration with the lack of availability.

Description: Good afternoon a Some of the most popular items we provide during our food distributions are spaghetti pasta and mac and cheese These items have not been on the menu for VA Partners for some time Might we expect to see them return to the menu soon Thank you for your assistance Nancye Campbell Groveton Baptist Church Sent from for Windows
Summary: Customer inquires about the availability of certain menu items.
Comments: 092024 0505Good afternoon I hope youre doing well Thank you for getting in touch about the Virginia Menu Weve been informed by our Virginia partners about the urgent need for staple food pantry items and were actively working with your Regional Team and the Food Resourcing Team to restock and maintain these essential items on the menu Were planning to send out a detailed communication about this matter later this week In the meantime our Food Resources Team has shared that the following items are expected to be restocked in the warehouse by midSeptemberearly October taking into consideration truck schedules and receiving scheduling AA A A A A A Milk 1 8 ounces AA A A A A A Spaghetti Sauce AA A A A A A Frozen Ground Chicken new AA A A A A A Frozen Turkey Breasts new AA A A A A A Juice box 100 apple AA A A A A A Corn Flour AA A A A A A Mixed Dried Beans AA A A A A A Lentils AA A A A A A Corn Flakes AA A A A A A Crisped Rice Cereal AA A A A A A Toasted OaTMs AA A A A A A Elbow Macaroni AA A A A A A Elbow Macaroni WW AA A A A A A Canned green beans AA A A A A A Instant coffee AA A A A A A Green Tea AA A A A A A Jelly Strawberry and Grape AA A A A A A Pancake Syrup AA A A A A A White rice Additionally I spoke to the Food Resources Team about Mac and Cheese today and they said that they are working on transferring it from the DC warehouse to the Virginia warehouse this week so you will see it restocked in the next week or so We truly value your feedback and want to reassure Virginia partners that we are committed to addressing this issue Thank you for bringing this to our attention Take care

Description: Hello I attended this training on the August 6th Zoom Thank you Samantha Stevens On Fri Sep 13 2024 at 2 Good afternoon Partners If you are receiving this email it means you have not yet attended one of our mandatory Hours of Operations Trainings There is a new feature available on PartnerLink that allows partners to update their hours of operations for their distributions This feature will enable you to keep your records up to date as required which is important for ensuring that we have the most current information in our internal systems for our clients to use Once approved the information collected from your updates will be linked to our online tool that clients can use to find food assistance To ensure that all partners understand how to use this function we have hosted three trainings and there is one session remaining on These sessions have been designed to demonstrate how to use this feature and provide an opportunity to speak to our team about PartnerLink and offer feedback Please note that this training is mandatory You can use this link to your agency Once you fill out the form entirely a Zoom link with a calendar invite will be sent to your email We only require one representative per agency to attend but we encourage all shoppers who have access to PartnerLink to join We suggest that this person work closely with the food program and have a deep understanding of operations While the training will be recorded and slides will be shared all partners are expected to attend the live training to meet the requirement If you have any questions please feel free to contact Customer Relations Thank you The Customer Relations Team
Summary: Customer attended a training session on PartnerLink and provides information on upcoming trainings.
Comments: 092024 0153Good afternoon Thank you for letting us know We have corrected our attendance records Thank you
input_text: Agency Administration -> Partner Trainings | Customer attended a training session on PartnerLink and provides information on upcoming trainings.

Description: Good morning My agency is limited to 1200 pounds of produce per month We are doing our distribution twice a month and for the month of December I noticed that much of the produce was by pallet even the mixed produce Are you considering making those into smaller bins for those who are limited to less than 2000 lbs

Comments: 122024 0307Good afternoon Marie I hope you are doing well Thank you for your question Yes our Food Resources team which is responsible for procuring food including produce items at the Food Bank was very much involved in the conversation and collaboration regarding the produce limits One of their initiatives is to start procuring cases for our smaller agencies that have produce limits under 2000 lbs I also want to remind you that if you see a pallet of for example 2000 lbs the system will allow you to order over your limit Customer Service will then reach out to you to discuss your options If that is the only item available at that time and no cases are offered we will permit the overage as long as it is not excessive Best | 122024 0365d20c5a0c84458e8ce1adb90d07460f587746e3af794928b2e7cd18bb41c3f4Thank you

Description: Hi Team Would any of you all be able to provide some more context here around the recall policy how we handle recalls in terms of client outreach Let me know or if there is another person who may be able to help here Thanks Alanna Garsson Kate Thursday December 12 2024 1050 AM Alanna King Gillian Kimura RE Quick Question Ah that is good to know Kate Garsson MPH Pronouns SheHer Manager Program Outreach and Education Inova Community Health 2700 Prosperity Ave Suite 266 Fairfax VA 22031 O 7036982552 Official Health System for Follow the Inova Healthy Plate Club onand Alanna King Thursday December 12 2024 1048 AM Garsson Kate Gillian Kimura Re Quick Question Yes we do notify clients It is up to the site to notify the clients so for the DDP sites those organizations along with our team will reach out to the who received food For our agency partners like you all who order from the menu they are responsible for contacting the individuals Best Alanna Alanna King Partnership Specialist VA Region Capital Area Food Bank P 5714824773 6833 Hill Park Dr Lorton VA 22079 From Garsson Kate Thursday December 12 2024 1042 AM Alanna King Gillian Kimura RE Quick Question Thank you For any of your direct distribution programs like the family markets do you do any notifications to individuals who received a product that was part of a recall ThataTMs one thing we are trying to determine as part of our process a if we should notify patients Kate Garsson MPH Pronouns SheHer Manager Program Outreach and Education Inova Community Health 2700 Prosperity Ave Suite 266 Fairfax VA 22031 O 7036982552 Official Health System for Follow the Inova Healthy Plate Club onand Alanna King Thursday December 12 2024 1034 AM Garsson Kate Gillian Kimura Re Quick Question Hi Kate Thank you for reaching out about this Let me know if I can help with anything else Alanna Food Recall Policy A food recall as defined by the FDA involves removing foods from the market that violate the regulations set by the US Food and Drug Administration Foods are recalled for various reasons primarily due to contamination or failure to disclose essential allergens on the product label Its important for food suppliers and distributors to stay informed about recalls as consuming recalled foods may lead to illness or injury If a product is recalled the details will be specific to the item reflecting the brand product name freezeby date and other relevant information pertaining to that specific product Items that do not match the description provided in the recall notice are not affected and can be safely consumed In the event of a recall it is recommended to return the product to the place of purchase or dispose of it to prevent consumption The Capital Area Food Bank constantly monitors FDA food recall notifications and maintains regular contact with vendors and suppliers In the event that we are made aware of a recalled inventory item we will take immediate steps to remove it from all upcoming orders and notify our partners who may have received the item since it was added to our menu Our Customer Service Team will use various communication channels to promptly inform all partners about the recall and the necessary steps to take with the product If you have received an item from Capital Area Food Bank that you suspect has caused illness please contact Customer Relations immediately Provide your contact information the date and time of the distribution where the food was distributed to clients a description of the issue with the product the item numbername the date you received the product from our warehouse and any illness or injury resulting from consuming the item The Customer Relations Team will handle your complaint seriously and alert the relevant teams at Capital Area Food Bank to address the issue promptly If you have any questions about this process please contact or 2026449845 Alanna King Partnership Specialist VA Region Capital Area Food Bank P 5714824773 6833 Hill Park Dr Lorton VA 22079 From Garsson Kate Wednesday December 11 2024 200 PM Alanna King Gillian Kimura Quick Question Good afternoon We are creating an internal process for handling food recalls for our food programs To inform this process IaTMm hoping to learn from others doing this work Do you know any healthcare systemsproviders that have onsite pantries and if so can you connect me Also from what I understand food bankspantries donaTMt do any notifications for recalls due to the Good Samaritan law However I want to make sure IaTMm correct a does CAFB do anything for recalls ie notifying pantries who received affected food Thanks Kate Kate Garsson MPH Pronouns SheHer Manager Program Outreach and Education Inova Community Health 2700 Prosperity Ave Suite 266 Fairfax VA 22031 O 7036982552 Official Health System for Follow the Inova Healthy Plate Club on and
Summary: Customer requests information on food recall policy and procedures, including notification of affected individuals and pantries.
Request Category: Agency Administration -> Connection to CAFB Staff
Comments: 122024 1101 | 122024 02 Request for Forwarding Ticket Good afternoon Alanna Im having trouble with the system it will not allow me to forward this ticket to Jessica or respond directly to the partner Could you please forward the response below on my behalf Thank you Good afternoon Thank you for reaching out to Customer Service You had a great question about our recall process For our DDP programs the recall outreach process differs from that of the partnership teams When a recall is identified our Food Resources Analytics and Operations Teams collaborate with our programs and my team to contact the partners who ordered the affected items It is then the partners responsibility to reach out to their clients For DDP the process is slightly different I recommend contacting Jessica Arias one of our managers on the DDP team to learn more about how they notify their sites and assist those sites in informing their respective clients Here is her contact information Jessica Arias Best regards | 122024 1058Thank you I passed that along Best Alanna | 122024 10f58131cbb67d43c7b30d6b58d40bd077Customer has replied after the ticket has been resolved

CoastalaTMs Customer Service Team to address the problem with your produce boxes that were not distributable Augusta has offered to follow up with them and relay any next steps back to you As for the peanut butter thank you for providing photos We appreciate it The peanut butter in your order as well as many of our other donated items have passed their date This date indicates when the product will be at its best flavor or quality and is not a safety date ItaTMs a quality date that encourages consumers to eat food while it is in its prime state Food that is past this date is not bad and should not be thrown away We provide a food coding guide to our partners that explains these dates further We want to reassure you that the peanut butter is not expired and will not cause any harm to consumers We offer the Food Coding Guides as a resource and we have them printed and available to order for partners as well to pass out at distributions Thank you

Comments: 042024 0457Good afternoon Thank you for contacting our Customer Service Id be happy to assist you with your query Our system applies grants on a perlineitem basis which means that only one grant can be applied to each line item In the case of your order the line item is 81700 and the system initially used the last of your FY24 MD Region Moco 1G grant which was 7559 However as per your request I have contacted our IT department to apply your FY24 MD Region MOCO 1I grant to that line item since it is the only grant you have that can cover the entire amount Please note that moving forward the 7559 remaining on your 1G grant and the 1801 left on your 1H grant may not cover the entire line item cost If this happens it is because our system applies the grants on a perlineitem basis If you have a line item that costs less than these amounts in future orders then you will have no remaining balance I hope this clarifies the situation If you have any more questions please feel Comments: 102024 0338c8249284fe40dc890161d65a68f6d3Good afternoon Thank you for reaching out We will not be hosting another training session but there are tools available to assist you You can find a guide in PDF format called under the Partner Resource Tab on PartnerLink This document provides instructions on how to update your hours of operation Once you are logged into PartnerLink click on your agency name to access your Account Overview Under Additional Information you will find a button labeled Click on it to view the hours currently listed for your agency If the hours are correct click to confirm If the hours are not correct please make the necessary changes by clicking aedita submit them and once approved by your Regional Coordinator the updated hours will be officially updated Screenshots have been included to provide visual guidance If you still need assistance please attend one of our online Office Hours every Wednesday from 10am10am Thank you CiArra

Description: What was the ordering error If I did something wrong IaTMd like to know so I donaTMt repeat it Marian Sent from my iPhone On Nov 25 2024 at 8 i Dear Valued Partner We regret to inform you that we had to remove or reduce the quantity of item from your order Below is a list of item and reason for the change We understand that this change may cause inconvenience to you and your distribution plans and we apologize for the inconvenience Please note that if you are receiving this notification after your order has been locked which is three business days before your order is due to be picked up or delivered this change is most likely occurring during or after the pulling stage and unfortunately we cannot replace the item removed or make any further additions during this time period Item Reason for Change Line Not Fulfilled in WH Ordering Error To review an updated version of your order please log in to PartnerLink and visit the Order History tab If you have any queries or concerns please do not hesitate to contact us at Thank you for your understanding and continued support Best regards Partner Support
Summary: Customer wants to know the reason for an order error.
Comments: 112024 0814Good morning Thank you for reaching out to us about this You did not do anything wrong An means that we ordered this product from a farmer or vendor and something went wrong with our order For example they may have been scheduled to deliver it one week but informed us they couldnt come until the following week or they told us we were supposed to receive 10 cases but only delivered 6 Rest assured this is not your fault Best

Description: Dear Partner Support Last Friday 225 sale order SO194429 was delivered to our location It included 3 bins of cereal item 100862 At first sight we noticed rodent droppings on top of cereal boxes in one of those bins That bin was not accepted and the delivery driver loaded it back up inside his truck The other two bins were b ought upstairs to our storage room To our surprise a few minutes later we saw a mouse coming out of one bin and returning inside that bin We had to act quickly since other food items were stored inside this room We immediately wrapped both bins loaded them inside our vehicle and drove to two landfill sites to dispatch the two open bins with donated assorted cereal Upon dispatching them our staff saw two mice This confirmed our fear that more than one mouse had entered inside our building and our storage room through the open bin cereals that we ordered Of course the issue was not over and the following Monday 225 we caught another mouse We will continue to closely monitor our storage room and other areas to be certain that the problem has been eradicated Attached are pictures of what was left behind after we removed the two bins out of the storage room This experience was very disturbing and a solution needs to be implemented quickly This put us behind schedule by four days due to the intervention that we put in place We also had to throw away our products that the mice had contaminated CAFB has been such a great partner to us and we are forever grateful for the all in support that you have been providing us to allow us to help our underserved communities That is why we are sharing this information and our experience to you so this can be further looked at and hopefully avoided We are in this together to strengthen food security so we know this kind of issue will be attended to and taken seriously by both parties We look forward to your feedback or resolution around this matter Thank you and Best regards Anna Beavan and Jeannette Mendy Jeannette Mendy
Summary: Customer reports a rodent infestation in their storage room and requests a solution to prevent future occurrences.
Comments: 022025 0665d20c5a0c84458e8ce1adb90d07460fe03b0d0106f5475f8f0864bb9a4a879a | 022025 0948Good morning Jeanette I hope youaTMre doing well today I was very concerned to hear about the issues youaTMve encountered with mice droppings and the presence of mice near the food you received from us Please know that I am genuinely sorry for this distressing experience and I want to extend my heartfelt apologies on behalf of Capital Area Food Bank and our Customer Service and Operations Team This morning I forwarded the information you provided in your ticket along with your photos to our Director of Operations She is taking this matter very seriously and has scheduled a meeting with her team to ensure we find a prompt and effective resolution They will be focusing on maintaining cleanliness and ensuring rodent protection in our facilities as well as inspecting our warehouse products particularly those in question to ensure they are removed if necessary I want to support you through this situation Could you please let me know which specific products you needed to be disposed of due to the potential rodent issue aside from the bins of cereal I understand how disruptive this can be to your food distribution efforts and I truly empathize with the challenges it presents in providing safe and healthy food to the community you serve I will also reach out to my supervisor to discuss possible compensation for the inconvenience caused by this situation as we value your partnership and want to make things right Thank you for your understanding and once again IaTMm truly sorry for the trouble this has caused We are committed to resolving this matter as quickly as possible Best wishes | 022025 0865d20c5a0c84458e8ce1adb90d07460fdfe95375aec24b96a4411ef83b9b12fbDear Thank you so much for your prompt response and for addressing this matter with great regard We look forward to hearing back from your side the resolution made from your side so this situation can be avoided When it comes to your questions around damages and pain points that we encounter to intervene quickly here are some of the damages it costs my operations We disregard about 50 Rx Boxes that were packed and ready for distribution to our Food as Medicine Program We halted our packing operations and had caused me loss of 500 Rx Boxes that should have been packed last week Instead we used the time to do a deep cleaning to ensure all our 800 Rx Boxes are safe We also use two additional days of work to contain and capture the three mice and safely throw the 2 bins of assorted cereals out of our building premises I hope this helps you and your organization understand how this type of matters can cause a small organization like ours not only inconvenienceinvestmentproductivity for some of our programs outside our Food Pantry operations | 022025 0657Anna I hope this message finds you well I wanted to reach out personally to follow up on the recent incident and to express my sincere apologies for any disruption it may have caused you I have escalated this matter to our Operations Director and I want you to know that we have a new leader in Operations who is dedicated to ensuring we serve our partners with the utmost care and precision She is committed to making improvements and has assured me that we are taking significant steps to prevent such situations from occurring in the future Some of the measures weaTMre implementing include 1 Continuing our routine pest control efforts 2 Collaborating with our pest control company which visited our facility on Monday to conduct additional work beyond our normal maintenance 3 Strengthening our inspection processes to ensure that all pullers drivers and inspectors thoroughly check every order once its staged 4 Focusing on the quality of products going out to our partners 5 Preparing for the warmer months ahead to maintain a rodentfree and clean environment for the food we deliver I truly empathize with the impact this situation may have had on your operations and I want to assure you that we are committed to providing a better service moving forward Please know that we value your partnership and appreciate your understanding during this time As a gesture of goodwill we would like to waive the delivery fees for both your recent order and your upcoming order on March 3rd If you have any questions or concerns please donaTMt hesitate to reach out Your feedback is important to us and weaTMre here to help Thank you for your understanding Warm regards | 022025 04cf16d72087c341018b8b4f2ba327b04eThanks

Description: Hello Please move SO160977 from Monday 524 to Tuesday 524 8am10am Thank you Partner Support Monday May 13 2024 410 PM DH CR CH Memorial Day 527 Dear Partners We hope this message finds you well We are reaching out to you today because we have discovered a system error that mistakenly marked Tuesday May 28th as Memorial Day instead of Monday May 27th As a result some of you were able to place an order for that day We apologize for any confusion this may have caused Please be advised that on the actual day of Memorial Day Monday May 27th Capital Area Food Bank will be closed Because of this we will need to move the day of your delivery to ensure that you receive your order on a different day that works with your schedule In order to make this change as quickly as possible please respond to this message at your earliest convenience with the most convenient day for your delivery We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and appreciate your understanding Thank you for your patience and cooperation Sincerely Partner Support DH Manager of Customer Relations Distribution Network Evolution Capital Area Food Bank P 5713909875 7035410179 4900 Puerto Rico Ave NE Washington DC 20017 Please email all customer service questions or concerns to so that one of my colleagues or I can assist you promptly Thank you

Description: Good morning I am sorry to hear about the spoiled bags you received I am looping in Partner Support who will coordinate with our inventory teams to let them know about the situation They are available 95PM every week day to assist with ordering issueschallenges Did you take any pictures Thanks Augusta Pastor Samantha DiBiaso Tuesday August 6 2024 314 PM CAFB MD Partnership Coordinator Letting you all know about some contaminated fod Hi Augusta We got a delivery from CAFB this week with various items There were a few mice openings in our corn meal bags We just wanted to let you all know and be aware We were able to keep a majority of the bags but had to get rid of a few If there is someone else I should notify please let me know Peace Pastor Samantha Pastor Samantha DiBiaso Living Faith Lutheran Church 1605 Veirs Mill Rd Rockville MD 20851

Description: Hi I am expecting a delivery on Monday January 6th and there is snow in the forecast I was hoping to review your inclement weather policies and the link sends me to 2024 Holidayspdf Would you please let me know what will happen if it snows and what do I need to do Thank you and Happy New Year Luanne Ailes Messiah UMC 7039277913
Summary: Customer wants to know about the company's inclement weather policies and how they will handle a snowstorm on their delivery day.
Comments: 012025 1122Good morning Luanne Happy New Year I hope you had a great holiday I have attached our Inclement Weather Policy below In the event that it snows we will wait for information from our leadership including the Head of Operations to determine if we will have a formal delay or closure we do not follow the governmentaTMs decisions regarding weather For example if we announce a 2hour delay all delivery and pickup windows will be pushed back accordingly This means that if you had an 8 AM 10 AM delivery it will now be scheduled for 10 AM 12 PM If we face a complete closure due to the weather there will be no deliveries or pickups On such days the Customer Relations team will be available to reschedule deliveries and reach out to all partners regarding their orders Additionally please keep in mind that depending on the amount of snow there may be impacts on the days following the snowfall If we do have a closure we will do our best to accommodate our partners schedules while ensuring that orders are not affected the following day I hope this helps Please let me know if you need any further information Best | 012025 0965d20c5a0c84458e8ce1adb90d07460f2b0cfede13de4a9894195cbca5c09cc6Thank you Luanne
input_text: Orders - Pre delivery -> General Questions | Customer wants to know about the company's inclement weather policies and how they will handle a snowstorm on their delivery day.

072024 0511Good afternoon Julia Thank you for contacting Customer Service Could you please specify if these donations were made from an outside source or if it was a CAFBdonated item I will be happy Description: Good Morning The delivery was made today by Mr Ebenezer However he refused to pick up the empty pallets HeaTMs the first driver who has not done this on the day of delivery Could you please send someone to pick them up Our space is very limited and we donaTMt have room for the empty pallets of last week I also made a mistake when signing the order and he was very upset Thank you Matilde Alvarado Mother of Light Center Sent from my iPhone
Summary: Customer requests assistance with picking up empty pallets from a delivery driver who refused to do so.
Comments: 102024 1013Good morning Mitilde I hope you are doing well Thank you for sharing your feedback with us it is very valuable I will follow up with the Transportation Leadership Team to address the way the drivers communicate with partners about this issue To provide some context there are two main reasons why drivers may not take pallets when dropping off food during a delivery Firstly they may have food for an immediate order or need to pick up food from another site for the warehouse which means they cannot have food and pallets on the truck at the same time due to food safety and consideration for our partners Secondly our drivers may be on tight schedules and do not have the time for a pallet pickup due to their busy delivery schedules especially during the busy season There is no reason why a driver could not explain this to you at the time and I will ensure that this information is communicated to them I apologize for your experience Thank you | 102024 1021I spoke with the Transportation Supervisor and she mentioned that she received feedback about the pallets not being stacked properly and having trash around them She has scheduled a pallet pickup for tomorrow Please make sure that the pallets are stacked together to allow the equipment to pick them up easily there is no debris around them and they are placed on concrete not on grass Thank you | 102024 1065d20c5a0c84458e8ce1adb90d07460f0263e0655e9f426c823043d43b0d7e07 This is how the pallets were placed We canaTMt stack them any higher so we have to put them to the side due to our limited space The driver was rude which is unusual as weaTMve always had great relationships with all the other drivers Thanks for picking the pallets soon Matilde On Oct 1 2024 at 10 i aaaa Reply above this line DH Description: Good morning I could not attend this meeting on 918 on hours of operations from Mother of Light Center Is there any way I can learn about it Sorry for the inconvenience I do not want our account for ordering closed Thank you Regards Matilde Alvarado Mother of Light Center 703 508 5289 On Mon Jul 29 2024 at 4 Capital Area Food Bank aS 2026449800 4900 Puerto Rico Ave NE Washington DC 20017
Summary: Customer wants to learn about a meeting on hours of operations from Mother of Light Center and does not want their account for ordering closed.
Comments: 102024 0909Good afternoon Thank you for reaching out We will not be hosting another training session but there are tools available to assist you You can find a guide in PDF format called under the Partner Resource Tab on PartnerLink This document provides instructions on how to update your hours of operation Once you are logged into PartnerLink click on your agency name to access your Account Overview Under Additional Information you will find a button labeled Click on it to view the hours currently listed for your agency If the hours are correct click to confirm If the hours are not correct please make the necessary changes by clicking aedita submit them and once approved by your Regional Coordinator the updated hours will be officially updated Screenshots have been included to provide visual guidance If you still need assistance please attend one of our online Office Hours every Wednesday from 10am10am Thank you Customer Service

Description: I contacted you about 2 months ago about items needed by our pantry that are no longer on your menu We need shelf stable milk 8oz size bottled water applesaucefruit cups 4oz individual cereal bowls granola bars juice boxes tuna pouches 2oz can soups I have checked everyday and nothing We have had to resort to costco and bjaTMs and even with that our shelves are sparse and our numbers of clients have increased Is there any help coming or should we continue to look for other resources of help Help is really needed Thanks in advance Laurese Dancy

Day and Labor Day are Monday through Thursday 8 am to 5 pm and Friday 8am to 3 pm We will respond to your request in a timely manner during business hours You can expect a response by 10 am the next that you would like of each item We will work on trying to build a more mixed menu to accommodate what your organization needs Thank you Charity | 062024 0565d20c5a0c84458e8ce1adb90d07460f Bottled water milk shelf stable 8oz juice box 610oz applesauce cup 4oz tuna pouch 2oz package of peanut butter cracker granola bar cereal in prepackaged bowl 2 saltine packs I hope this helps When I order it is based on need and the amount of storage space we have Usually it is 5060 cases of milk 1218 cases of applesauce pallet or water These items usually last 2 3months Items we get from Sckenck Foods include 14 prepackaged cereal bowls 8 peanut butter cracker 2030 juice boxes 6 saltines 8 cookies Trips to BJs Costco Walmart and Amazon provide some of the above and also the 50 tuna Sometimes we even get Vienna sausages Granted none of this is considered healthy but it is convenient and ready to eat We also distribute canned goods to those who have a place to cook a week Let me know if you have any questions or need anything else | 062024 12b15fa988bc6049b4aa6fe30b7a3629c1Thank you for the insight Our Food Resourcing team will be using this information to incorporate more ReadyToEat for updates Charity

Description: Lucy First let me thank you and the TEFAP program for allowing us to serve We have been a part of the Capital Area Food Bank since 2009 thats 15 years of service The volunteers that come to work with us do so at the kindness of their heart Our Community is multcultural People who are afraid of the impact of completing the form At the Civil Rights meeting I asked the question of how we can educate the community to help them understand that they wouldnt lose their benefits by completing the form By saying you cant have food unless you fill out the form is heartbreaking We are doing what we can and to constantly be threatened of suspension is not a good feeling I cant imagine any agency taking such steps over FOOD These volunteers have worked tirelessly If you need to come and get the foods we have please feel free to do so Let us know the date and time so that someone will be available I spoke to Cynthia and she informed me that was distributed in August I will do the inventory send you the forms we collected and that is all we can do Best Dr Claudine Head On Thu Oct 24 2024 at 9 Good Morning Dr Head I thought it would be best to answer on this email thread as you can more easily refer back to the Corrective Action Plan attached to the first email I appreciate you sending along the pictures of the temperature logs and the civil rights training certificate The Corrective Action Plan outlines 2 issues the missing SDI forms and missing inventory reports The due date of 102024 was for the signed Corrective Action Plan to be emailed back to me along with a plan to prevent this issue from happening again in the future please see the last bullet point below each issue and lastly the missing inventory reports to be submitted In your case that is May and August of 2024 Like said in one of the emails below if you submitted the missing months you should have received an email with a PDF copy via email If you could send me that then it would clear up the missing inventory reports Since I will be out of town tomorrow Friday 1028 I will allow for one additional extension The new date is Wednesday October 30th 2024 Please know that if these items are not submitted by end of day on October 30th there will be a suspension placed on your TEFAP account Any suspension that I do does not impact your ability to order regular CAFB food To recap the final submission deadline for the signed CAP summaries and missing reports are due by End of Day 5pm on Wednesday October 30th I hope this clarifies any confusion Best Lucy MD TEFAP Coordinator Capital Area Food Bank 2026449800 2025271767 lparedes 4900 Puerto Rico Ave NE Washington DC 20017 New Hope And Life Church of God Friday October 18 2024 959 AM Lucy Paredes Re Corrective Action Plan New Hope and Life Church of God Good morning Lucy I plan to forward the certificate to you tomorrow Also the other person that was at the training took the forms to make the certificates We would not have been issued the certificate if we werent there There should be some accountability also on the facilitators part I signed the form upon coming into the room Best Dr Head On Wed Oct 16 2024 at 6 Good evening Dr Head Below are some clarification points Monthly Inventory Reports I have attached what I am able to see on my end as far as submitted reports If you submitted them you should have received an email with a PDF copy via email If you could send me that then it would clear up the missing inventory reports Civil Rights Training I did remember talking with you however I did not see your name on the sign in sheets see attached document for reference If you could please let me know which day you attended then I can send you the PDF copy for you to sign and return If you need any further clarification on either of the topics above we can do a phone call tomorrow or Friday Best Lucy From New Hope And Life Church of God Wednesday October 16 2024 at 156a PM Lucy Paredes Re Corrective Action Plan New Hope and Life Church of God Good afternoon Lucy Im not sure I understand These surveys were completed already I signed the roster when I came into the training Also the certificate is at the Church You and I spoke at the training when you told me about the corrective action We will sign the corrective action plan and send it back next week Dr Head On Wed Oct 16 2024 at 1 Good Afternoon Dr Head Attached please find the corrective action plan for New Hope and Life Church of God The following are the links for the monthly inventory reporting May 2024 August 2024 Dr Head could you please confirm your attendance for the civil rights training by sending the certificate received Once received I will forward you the signin sheet for you to sign and verify that you or a representative did indeed attend the training If you did not attend please let me know and I will send along the last 2 makeup dates I am here to help and support in any way that I can so please feel free to reach out to me via email as this is the best way to be able to refer back to information if there were ever any followup questions or concerns I am also happy to touch base via phone call and I will always send a recap of the conversation via email Please return the signed corrective action plan along with a summary of your plan for each issue outlined by Wednesday October 23rd Best Lucy Lucy Paredes MD TEFAP Coordinator Capital Area Food Bank P 2026449800 2025271767 lparedes 4900 Puerto Rico Ave NE Washington DC 20017 New Hope And Life School of Religion Theology Seminary 8616 Edgeworth Drive Capitol Heights MD 20743 3245200 3247100 fax New Hope And Life School of Religion Theology Seminary 8616 Edgeworth Drive Capitol Heights MD 20743 3245200 3247100 fax
Summary: The customer is requesting clarification on missing inventory reports and civil rights training.
Request Category: Agency Administration -> Connection to CAFB Staff
Comments: 102024 1165d20c5a0c84458e8ce1adb90d07460fd1421a49e82e485d91d93d9efdc42ae1 | 102024 01e3f1b9a5afcd4846bd163cc8c3d8a80cDr Head We appreciate the wonderful service you provide to your community and your partnership with CAFB for the last 15 years Different programs within CAFB have different rules and regulations TEFAP falls under the rules and regulations of MD DHS collection of SDI forms is one of the requirements set forth by them not by myself or by CAFB I completely understand that the work that you and all your volunteers do is hard and exhausting work We also understand that not everyone is able to qualifies for or feels comfortable completing the SDI form This is why we do always recommend there be non TEFAP food set aside for those do not qualify or are unable to complete the SDI form My goal is not to suspend New Hope and Life Church of God it is to work with you and each partner to ensure there is compliance with regulations set forth by MD DHS to work together when other problems arise and to get to know each partner to the best of my ability so that I can continue to advocate for change at the state level Regarding the monthly inventory report for the month of August like covered in the civil rights training regardless of whether food was distributed a report must still be submitted In the case of no distribution you would just need to put 0 under the household and individuals served note any inventory you have at the time sign and submit I can also look at your sales order record and send you the food ordered around that time frame which may help in the completion of the report I do want to remind you that I am out of town tomorrow Friday October 24th and Monday October 28th Like stated in the previous emails what needs to be submitted on Wednesday October 23rd is the signed corrective action plan a summary of how you will be collecting SDI forms and submission of the monthly inventory reports that have not yet been submitted Submission of the reports can be through the links originally sent or if your organization completed the reports previously they should have been sent an email copy of the report which can then be emailed to me I appreciate your patience understanding and the work you and you organization does for the community Best Lucy
input_text: Agency Administration -> Connection to CAFB Staff | The customer is requesting clarification on missing inventory reports and civil rights training.

Description: Hi AcNeal Thank you for following up here I believe you should have received an automatic email with log in information Did you not receive this If not they can reset your log in and re send the email Thank you Alanna AcNeal Williams Tuesday July 16 2024 159 PM Partner Support Alanna King Re Platform Access 2nd Inquiry Good afternoon This is my second follow up with reference to acquiring access to my shopping account I was told by Charity that I would receive certain bits of information pertinent to my registration To the best of my knowledge that information has not been received Would someone be able to assist here AcNeal Williams Monday July 8 2024 1200 PM partnersupportcapitalareafoodbankorg Platform Access Good morning I wanted to inquire as to how I go about acquiring my passwords I was told by Charity that because I will be servicing multiple locations that it would be best if I used passwords set up by CAFB If it has not been done already I have suggestions that will make it easy for me to navigate and remember Eleanor Kennedy Center Operations1k Baileys Shelter Operations1b If I need to have a special character I would like to add an asterisk to each at the end Rethinking homelessness 7037992293 ext 31 7035171795 awilliamsnewhopehousingorg linkedincomnewhopehousing Work place and Work address Alexandria VA 22309 IMPORTANT THIS EMAIL IS CONFIDENTIAL INTENDED ONLY FOR THE NAMED RECIPIENT AND MAY CONTAIN INFORMATION THAT IS PRIVILEGED OR EXEMPT FROM DISCLOSURE UNDER APPLICABLE LAW IF YOU ARE NOT THE INTENDED RECIPIENT YOU ARE NOTIFIED THAT DISSEMINATION DISTRIBUTION OR COPYING OF THIS MESSAGE IS STRICTLY PROHIBITED IF YOU RECEIVE THIS MESSAGE IN ERROR OR ARE NOT THE NAMED RECIPIENT PLEASE NOTIFY THE SENDER AT THE EMAIL ADDRESS ABOVE AND DELETE THIS EMAIL FROM YOUR COMPUTER THANK YOU

Comments: 072024 1249 | 072024 12f58131cbb67d43c7b30d6b58d40bd077Hi Alanna King We just received your request for assistance We will reply as soon as possible Thank you Customer Relations Capital Area Food Bank | 072024 0144f7647684e54a709ec9f416f5d62412Under normal circumstances yes However while speaking with Charity during the training and relaying that I would like to separate the locations she told me in stead of selecting my own credentials through the link CAFB would create them for me using my email address for all but a different password for each Because of this special circumstance she said that I would not have received the usual email I would receive an email detailing all locations and passwords | 072024 0204Okay I see my apologies Currently we have New Hope Housing Kennedy Shelter on Richmond Highway in our records as your approved address Our partner support team will be happy to get you the login in to that account If you would like to add a different location I will need to conduct a site visit to ensure food safety and we will need to have a larger conversation around how the food will be distributed between the two sites I believe when we spoke on the phone previously we agreed you would begin ordering again for the Kennedy Shelter to see the types of food we have available I understood then from there we would see if it made sense to add another location or not based on the different needs Just a reminder CAFB food can only be delivered to and stored at the Kennedy Shelter address Please let me know if that helps Best Alanna | 072024 0244f7647684e54a709ec9f416f5d62412If under the present circumstances food purchased from CAFB can only be delivered to and stored at the Kennedy location I would like to take the required steps to add our Baileys location Additionally for accounting purposes it is much better for us to separate the purchases I am happy to arrange the Baileys site visit

Description: Good Morning A few months ago we were contacted about switching our distribution day from Tuesday to a later day in the week and we agreed to move it to Wednesday However weaTMve found that having only one day between our distribution dates has been challenging for our volunteers and has created scheduling conflicts with some of our other pickups Now that the holidays are over weaTMd like to request switching back to our original Tuesday distribution This change would allow us to serve the community more effectively and provide our volunteers with adequate time to recover between distributions We understand the importance of aligning with your delivery schedule and want to remain considerate of your operations However we would greatly appreciate it if this adjustment could be made Please let us know if this is possible Looking forward to hearing from you Best regards Oliver
Summary: Customer requests to switch back to original Tuesday distribution due to scheduling conflicts and volunteer challenges.
Comments: 012025 0131Good afternoon Mr Oliver I hope this message finds you well Thank you for bringing this to our attention I have discussed this matter with our leadership and the team involved in this initiative We appreciate you reopening the discussion When we initiated this plan our goal was to alleviate the burden on our Tuesday schedule due to the number of large deliveries we have on that day However we acknowledge the challenges this has caused for your agency which was not our intended outcome LetaTMs work together to find a solution One option I wanted to explore with you is whether you would be open to either receiving all your food items on Fridays or accepting deliveries on Mondays instead of Tuesdays Please let me know your preference and if neither option works for you I will take that information back to our department leaders and Operations for further consideration Our aim is to ensure that we do not burden your distribution or volunteers Thank you Pastor Oliver Best regards | 022025 1202Good morning Mr Oliver just checking in here to see if you saw my response | 022025 1265d20c5a0c84458e8ce1adb90d07460f74130ac6426b474b8c00611618928c9fHello thanks for your follow up We will maintain our schedule for now I will continue to check in with your delivery team and keep you posted | 022025 1220Thank you Pastor Oliver Please let me know if you need anything DH Manager of Customer Relations Distribution Network Evolution Capital Area Food Bank P 5713909875 2025260558 4900 Puerto Rico Ave NE Washington DC 20017
input_text: Delivery / Pickup -> General Questions | Customer requests to switch back to original Tuesday distribution due to scheduling conflicts and volunteer challenges.

Description: Hello We need to pick up about 5 boxes to put in the retails stores that we pick up from Can you let me know if and when we can pick them up
Summary: Customer wants to know when they can pick up 5 boxes of food for retail stores.
Request Category: Agency Administration -> Connection to CAFB Staff
Comments: 122024 0910Good morning Thank you for reaching out to Customer Service You can pick up donation boxes at the food bank from Monday to Friday 8 AM to 4 PM at our warehouse in Washington DC If you arrive between 8 AM and 2 PM please go to the side of the warehouse designated for partner pickups If you cannot come during those hours please visit the front of the building where our receptionist is located and ask for donation boxes from 2 PM to 4 PM Please note that our CAFB donation boxes cannot be used for partner donations For example you should not place them outside stores for accepting donations to your organization If you are raising awareness and fundraising for your organization please refrain from using the CAFB branded boxes Thank you
input_text: Agency Administration -> Connection to CAFB Staff | Customer wants to know when they can pick up 5 boxes of food for retail stores.

Description: My name is Gladys Reid I signed up but didnaTMt how to get the link for the meeting Please get back with me and tell me the next steps Gladys Reid On Friday September 13 2024 3 Good afternoon Partners If you are receiving this email it means you have not yet attended one of our mandatory Hours of Operations Trainings There is a new feature available on PartnerLink that allows partners to update their hours of operations for their distributions This feature will enable you to keep your records up to date as required which is important for ensuring that we have the most current information in our internal systems for our clients to use Once approved the information collected from your updates will be linked to our online tool that clients can use to find food assistance To ensure that all partners understand how to use this function we have hosted three trainings and there is one session remaining on These sessions have been designed to demonstrate how to use this feature and provide an opportunity to speak to our team about PartnerLink and offer feedback Please note that this training is mandatory You can use this link to your agency Once you fill out the form entirely a Zoom link with a calendar invite will be sent to your email We only require one representative per agency to attend but we encourage all shoppers who have access to PartnerLink to join We suggest that this person work closely with the food program and have a deep understanding of operations While the training will be recorded and slides will be shared all partners are expected to attend the live training to meet the requirement If you have any questions please feel free to contact Customer Relations Thank you The Customer Relations Team
Summary: Customer wants to know the next steps for updating their hours of operations on PartnerLink.
Comments: 092024 0143Good afternoon The training is 9 am10 am via zoom on September 19th DH is inviting you to a scheduled Zoom meeting Join Zoom Meeting Meeting ID 869 3918 0220 Passcode 077793 Thank you
input_text: Agency Administration -> Partner Trainings | Customer wants to know the next steps for updating their hours of operations on PartnerLink.

Comments: 012025 1211Good morning I hope you are doing well Happy New Year Since we were closed from December 25th until January 2nd the last day to place an order for January 6th was December 24th in accordance with our three business day fulfillment rule This is why you were unable to make an order for January 6th and we sincerely apologize for any inconvenience Please note that anytime a day is marked in gray on the calendar it either means that the calendar is full or the day is no longer available due to the deadline for placing an order having passed You can schedule a delivery or pickup for Tuesday January 7th until the end of the day on January 3rd There are still some slots available so please take a look soon to secure an available time Thank you
